docs.text: the seasoned capt . dudley smith ( james cromwell ) questions his new protege , ed exley ( guy pearce ) about his political views when it comes to police work .

docs.text: " would you plant evidence to get a conviction if you knew the person to be guilty ?

docs.text: exley , squeaky clean , innocent , and pent with the desire to perform his new duties with integrity and honesty quickly answers with a pointed 'no . '

docs.text: la confidential is a dandy piece of filmmaking that brings us back to the classic times of hollywood in the 50s .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: organized crime was the biggest concern , corruption existed everywhere , and every cop had his own way of getting the job done .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there was " hollywood " jack vincennes ( kevin spacey ) who gets most of his information from the editor of a sleazy tell-all/show-all tabloid , sid hudgeons ( danny devito ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sporting dark sunglasses and a white sports coat , he isn't afraid to flash his tinseltown style .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: detective bud white ( russell crowe ) has only a narrow-minded view of the law , and he uses excessive force to exact his unique kind of interrogation and brutal justice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and then there is golden boy exley , wide-eyed and ambitious but extremely naive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a horrible multiple murder begins to draw these three men together , each of whom become inexorably connected in their search for truth , action , and personal vindication .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: almost immediately , an arrest is made .

docs.text: but something doesn't seem quite right .

docs.text: new developments become sinuous as the story begins to draw us deeper into the labyrinth of corruption and crime within the department .

docs.text: and as layers of the truth become revealed , the story grows more complex and intriguing by the moment .

docs.text: when the mystery expands , we see other seemingly guilty characters enter the lives of these three cops , including a high-priced hooker ( kim basinger ) and a shady millionaire ( david strathairn ) .

docs.text: all of the characters' levels of involvement are not immediately clear .

docs.text: we watch with riveted fascination to learn more about why they are there and their stake in the case .

docs.text: we sense a cross-pollination of clues that brings us , the audience , closer to the truth .

docs.text: we hope that the three detectives can throw away their spite for one another and can pull their resources together in order to untangle the intricately created web of mystery .

docs.text: absorbing and affecting , this movie has all the necessary ingredients to create a terrific gourmet serving of film noir .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it boasts mysterious figures in control , double-crosses , hard information from sleazy sources , dirty politicians , corrupt cops , haunting women , and hard-nosed cops experiencing moral ambiguity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the underlying mystery is compelling .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the look and feel of the movie is gorgeous .

docs.text: the entire cast is crisp and wonderful to watch ( i wouldn't be surprised if cromwell received an oscar nomination for his performance ) .

docs.text: and , the dialogue is rich and memorable .

docs.text: " l . a . confidential'' triumphantly achieves the rare gift of complexity and coherence while satisfying our desire for a good old-fashioned movie .
